intro: Macrostylis cordata, commonly known as the heartleaf macrostylis, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, commonly known as the carrot or parsley family. The plant is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and small, yellowish-white flowers that appear in umbels. It typically grows in moist, wooded areas and thrives in partial to full shade. Due to its unique morphology and habitat preferences, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
